00059 typedef struct
00060 {
00061         PyObject_HEAD;
00062         struct context ctx;

00106         linuxtuples_doc_string[] =
00107         "This is the Python client API for the linuxtuples tuple server. The\n"
00108         "connect() method returns a connection to the tuple server. The\n"
00109         "random() method returns a 32-bit integer taken from /dev/urandom.";

00111 
00112 static char
00113         ctx_doc_string[] =
00114         "This is a connection to a tuple server. Its methods give access to\n"
00115         "tuple space.\n"
00116         "\n"
00117         "The put(tuple) method lets you put a tuple into the tuple space.\n"
00118         "get(template) removes a tuple that matches the template (where None is\n"
00119         "used as a wildcard), blocking until a matching tuple becomes\n"
00120         "available. read(template) is like get(), but it returns a copy of the\n"
00121         "tuple, leaving the original in tuple space.\n"
00122         "\n"
00123         "get_nonblocking() and read_nonblocking() are non-blocking versions of\n"
00124         "get() and read(), which return None if a matching tuple is not\n"
00125         "available.\n"
00126         "\n"
00127         "The dump() method returns a list of the tuples in tuple space. If\n"
00128         "supplied with a list of templates as an argument, it will return a\n"
00129         "list of only those tuples that match at least one template.\n"
00130         "\n"
00131         "The log() method prints a running log of tuple server activity to\n"
00132         "stdout. It should be called in a \"while 1:\" loop.";
00133

00139         {"put", ctx_put_tuple, METH_VARARGS,
00140          ctx_put_doc_string},
00141         {"get", ctx_get_tuple, METH_VARARGS,
00142          ctx_get_doc_string},
00143         {"read", ctx_read_tuple, METH_VARARGS,
00144          ctx_read_doc_string},
00145         {"get_nonblocking", ctx_get_nb_tuple, METH_VARARGS,
00146          ctx_get_nb_doc_string},
00147         {"read_nonblocking", ctx_read_nb_tuple, METH_VARARGS,
00148          ctx_read_nb_doc_string},
00149         {"replace", ctx_replace_tuple, METH_VARARGS,
00150          ctx_replace_doc_string},
00151         {"dump", ctx_dump_tuple_space, METH_VARARGS,
00152          ctx_dump_doc_string},
00153         {"count", ctx_count_tuple_space, METH_VARARGS,
00154          ctx_count_doc_string},
00155         {"log", ctx_tuple_server_log, METH_VARARGS,
00156          ctx_log_doc_string},
00157         {NULL, NULL, 0, NULL}   /* sentinel */
00158 };

00163 static PyObject *
00164 ctx_getattr(CtxObject * obj, char *name)
00165 {
00166         if (strcmp(name, "__doc__") == 0) {
00167                 return PyString_FromString(ctx_doc_string);
00168         }
00169         return Py_FindMethod(ctx_methods, (PyObject *) obj, name);
00170 }

00175 "LINUXTUPLES_PORT). Please set them."

00178 static char
00179         new_ctx_doc_string[] =
00180         "conn = connect()          [ get host and port# from env. vars]\n"
00181         "conn = connect(string,int)   [ set host and port# explicitly ]\n"
00182         "Return a connection to the tuple server.";
00183 
00187 static PyObject *
00188 new_ctx(PyObject * self, PyObject * args)
00189 {
00190         CtxObject *pyctx = NULL;
00191         char *host = NULL;
00192         int port = -1;
00193         if (PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|si", &host, &port)) {
00194                 pyctx = PyObject_New(CtxObject, &CtxType);
00195                 pyctx->ctx.id = 0;
00196                 if (host != NULL) {
00197                         if (port == -1) {
00198                                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00199                                                 "try connect(hostname,"
00200                                                 " portnumber)");
00201                                 return NULL;
00202                         }
00203                         strcpy(pyctx->ctx.peername, host);
00204                         pyctx->ctx.portnumber = port;
00205                 }
00206                 else if (get_server_portnumber(&pyctx->ctx)) {
00207                         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ImportError, SETENV_STRING);
00208                         return NULL;
00209                 }
00210         }
00211         /* If bad args, return NULL */
00212         return (PyObject *) pyctx;
00213 }
00214 
00218 static void
00219 ctx_dealloc(PyObject * self)
00220 {
00221         CtxObject *pyctx = (CtxObject *) self;
00222         close(pyctx->ctx.sock);
00223         PyObject_Del(self);
00224 }
00225 
00229 static PyTypeObject CtxType = {
00230         PyObject_HEAD_INIT(NULL)
00231                 0,
00232         "Ctx",
00233         sizeof(CtxObject),
00234         0,
00235         ctx_dealloc,            /*tp_dealloc */
00236         0,                      /*tp_print */
00237         (getattrfunc) ctx_getattr,      /*tp_getattr */
00238         0,                      /*tp_setattr */
00239         0,                      /*tp_compare */
00240         0,                      /*tp_repr */
00241         0,                      /*tp_as_number */
00242         0,                      /*tp_as_sequence */
00243         0,                      /*tp_as_mapping */
00244         0,                      /*tp_hash */
00245 };

00255 static struct tuple *
00256 PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(PyObject * pytup, int puttable)
00257 {
00258         int i, len;
00259         struct tuple *t;
00260         len = PyTuple_Size(pytup);
00261         t = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple));
00262         if (t == NULL) {
00263                 return (struct tuple *) PyErr_NoMemory();
00264         }
00265         t->num_elts = len;
00266         t->elements = malloc(t->num_elts * sizeof(struct element));
00267         if (t->elements == NULL) {
00268                 return (struct tuple *) PyErr_NoMemory();
00269         }
00270         t->string_space = NULL;
00271         t->string_length = 0;
00272 
00273         for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00274                 PyObject *elem;
00275                 elem = PyTuple_GetItem(pytup, i);
00276                 if (elem == Py_None) {
00277                         if (puttable)
00278                                 goto bad_element;
00279                         t->elements[i].tag = '?';
00280                 }
00281                 else if (PyInt_Check(elem)) {
00282                         t->elements[i].tag = 'i';
00283                         t->elements[i].data.i = PyInt_AsLong(elem);
00284                 }
00285                 else if (PyFloat_Check(elem)) {
00286                         t->elements[i].tag = 'd';
00287                         t->elements[i].data.d = PyFloat_AsDouble(elem);
00288                 }
00289                 else if (PyString_Check(elem)) {
00290                         int n = PyString_Size(elem);
00291                         t->elements[i].tag = 's';
00292                         t->elements[i].data.s.ptr = PyString_AsString(elem);
00293                         t->elements[i].data.s.len = n;
00294                         t->string_length += n;
00295                 }
00296                 else if (PyTuple_Check(elem)) {
00297                         t->elements[i].tag = 't';
00298                         t->elements[i].data.t = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(elem, puttable);
00299                 }
00300                 else {
00301                       bad_element:
00302                         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,
00303                                         "Bad element in LinuxTuples tuple");
00304                         return NULL;
00305                 }
00306         }
00307         return t;
00308 }
00309 
00310 
00314 static PyObject *
00315 LinuxTuple_to_PyTuple(struct tuple *t)
00316 {
00317         PyObject *pytup;
00318         int i;
00319         /*
00320          * Unpack the Linuxtuples tuple to a Python tuple.
00321          */
00322         pytup = PyTuple_New(t->num_elts);
00323         if (pytup == NULL)
00324                 return PyErr_NoMemory();
00325         for (i = 0; i < t->num_elts; i++) {
00326                 PyObject *ob;
00327                 switch (t->elements[i].tag) {
00328                 case '?':
00329                         Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00330                         PyTuple_SetItem(pytup, i, Py_None);
00331                         break;
00332                 case 'i':
00333                         ob = PyInt_FromLong(t->elements[i].data.i);
00334                         if (ob == NULL)
00335                                 return PyErr_NoMemory();
00336                         PyTuple_SetItem(pytup, i, ob);
00337                         break;
00338                 case 'd':
00339                         ob = PyFloat_FromDouble(t->elements[i].data.d);
00340                         if (ob == NULL)
00341                                 return PyErr_NoMemory();
00342                         PyTuple_SetItem(pytup, i, ob);
00343                         break;
00344                 case 's':
00345                         ob = PyString_FromStringAndSize(t->elements[i].data.
00346                                                         s.ptr,
00347                                                         t->elements[i].data.
00348                                                         s.len);
00349                         if (ob == NULL)
00350                                 return PyErr_NoMemory();
00351                         PyTuple_SetItem(pytup, i, ob);
00352                         break;
00353                 case 't':
00354                         ob = LinuxTuple_to_PyTuple(t->elements[i].data.t);
00355                         PyTuple_SetItem(pytup, i, ob);
00356                         break;
00357                 }
00358         }
00359         return pytup;
00360 }

00371 static PyObject *
00372 ctx_put_tuple(PyObject * self, PyObject * args)
00373 {
00374         CtxObject *pyctx = (CtxObject *) self;
00375         PyObject *pytup;
00376         struct tuple *t;
00377 
00378         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O", &pytup))
00379                 return NULL;
00380         if (!PyTuple_Check(pytup)) {
00381                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError, "argument must be a tuple");
00382                 return NULL;
00383         }
00384 
00385         t = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(pytup, 1);
00386         if (t == NULL) {
00387                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00388                                 "PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple failed "
00389                                 "for some reason");
00390                 return NULL;
00391         }
00392 
00393         /*
00394          * Put the Linuxtuples tuple in the tuple space.
00395          */
00396 
00397         if (put_tuple(t, &pyctx->ctx)) {
00398                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError, "put() failed");
00399                 return NULL;
00400         }
00401         destroy_tuple(t);
00402 
00403         Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00404         return Py_None;
00405 }
00406 
00407 
00408 static char
00409         ctx_replace_doc_string[] =
00410         "conn.replace(templ, replacement)\n" "Remove all tuples matching the template, and put a single replacement into the space.";
00411 
00415 static PyObject *
00416 ctx_replace_tuple(PyObject *self, PyObject *args)
00417 {
00418         CtxObject *pyctx = (CtxObject *) self;
00419         PyObject *pytemplate, *pyreplacement;
00420         struct tuple *template, *replacement;
00421 
00422         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "OO", &pytemplate, &pyreplacement))
00423                 return NULL;
00424         if (!PyTuple_Check(pytemplate) || !PyTuple_Check(pyreplacement)) {
00425                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError, "argument must be a tuple");
00426                 return NULL;
00427         }
00428 
00429         template = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(pytemplate, 0); // can be non-putable
00430         replacement = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(pyreplacement, 1); // putable
00431         if (template == NULL || replacement == NULL) {
00432                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00433                                 "PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple failed "
00434                                 "for some reason");
00435                 return NULL;
00436         }
00437 
00438         /*
00439          * Remove tuples matching the template
00440          */
00441 
00442 
00443         /*
00444          * Put the Linuxtuples tuple in the tuple space.
00445          */
00446 
00447         if (replace_tuple(template, replacement, &pyctx->ctx)) {
00448                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError, "replace() failed");
00449                 return NULL;
00450         }
00451         destroy_tuple(template);
00452         destroy_tuple(replacement);
00453 
00454         Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00455         return Py_None;
00456 }

00459 
00463 static PyObject *
00464 ctx_get_read(CtxObject * pyctx,
00465              PyObject * args,
00466              struct tuple *(*func) (struct tuple *,
00467                                     struct context *), int blocking)
00468 {
00469         PyObject *pytup;
00470         struct tuple *s, *t;
00471 
00472         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O", &pytup))
00473                 return NULL;
00474         if (!PyTuple_Check(pytup)) {
00475                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError, "argument must be a tuple");
00476                 return NULL;
00477         }
00478 
00479         /*
00480          * Build a LinuxTuples tuple template.
00481          */
00482         s = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(pytup, 0);
00483         if (s == NULL) {
00484                 return NULL;
00485         }
00486 
00487         /*
00488          * Get a Linuxtuples tuple from the tuple space.
00489          */
00490         Py_BEGIN_ALLOW_THREADS
00491         t = (*func) (s, &pyctx->ctx);
00492         Py_END_ALLOW_THREADS
00493         destroy_tuple(s);
00494         if (t == (struct tuple *) -1) {
00495                 goto abject_failure;
00496         }
00497         if (!blocking && t == NULL) {
00498                 Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00499                 return Py_None;
00500         }
00501         if (t == NULL) {
00502               abject_failure:
00503                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError, "get() or read() failed");
00504                 return NULL;
00505         }
00506 
00507         /*
00508          * Unpack the Linuxtuples tuple to a Python tuple.
00509          */
00510         pytup = LinuxTuple_to_PyTuple(t);
00511         destroy_tuple(t);
00512         return pytup;
00513 }

00586 static char
00587         ctx_dump_doc_string[] =
00588         "tuple_list = conn.dump( [template_list] )\n"
00589         "Return a list of the tuples in the tuple space. If no template\n"
00590         "list is given, return all the tuples. If there is a template\n"
00591         "list, return only the tuples that match at least one template.";
00592 
00597 static PyObject *
00598 ctx_dump_tuple_space(PyObject * self, PyObject * args)
00599 {
00600         PyObject *pylst = NULL, *pytup;
00601         CtxObject *pyctx;
00602         struct tuple_list *slist, *tlist, *x;
00603         int i, count, listsize;
00604 
00605         pyctx = (CtxObject *) self;
00606         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|O", &pylst))
00607                 return NULL;
00608         if (pylst != NULL) {
00609                 if (!PyList_Check(pylst)) {
00610                         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00611                                         "argument must be a list");
00612                         return NULL;
00613                 }
00614                 listsize = PyList_Size(pylst);
00615         }
00616         else {
00617                 listsize = 0;
00618         }
00619 
00620 
00621         /* Assemble a list of templates from the arg.
00622          */
00623         slist = NULL;
00624         for (i = 0; i < listsize; i++) {
00625                 pytup = PyList_GetItem(pylst, i);
00626                 if (!PyTuple_Check(pytup)) {
00627                         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00628                                         "list members must be tuples");
00629                         return NULL;
00630                 }
00631                 x = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple_list));
00632                 if (x == NULL)
00633                         return PyErr_NoMemory();
00634                 x->tup = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(pytup, 0);
00635                 x->next = slist;
00636                 slist = x;
00637         }
00638 
00639         x = slist;
00640         while (x != NULL) {
00641                 x = x->next;
00642         }
00643 
00644         /* Do a dump request to the server.
00645          */
00646         tlist = dump_tuple_space(slist, &pyctx->ctx);
00647         while (slist) {
00648                 x = slist;
00649                 slist = slist->next;
00650                 free(x);
00651         }
00652 
00653         count = 0;
00654         x = tlist;
00655         while (x != NULL) {
00656                 count++;
00657                 x = x->next;
00658         }
00659         pylst = PyList_New(count);
00660         if (pylst == NULL)
00661                 return PyErr_NoMemory();
00662         for (i = 0, x = tlist; x != NULL; x = x->next, i++)
00663                 PyList_SetItem(pylst, i, LinuxTuple_to_PyTuple(x->tup));
00664 
00665         while (tlist) {
00666                 x = tlist;
00667                 tlist = tlist->next;
00668                 free(x);
00669         }
00670 
00671         return pylst;
00672 }
00673 
00674 static char
00675         ctx_count_doc_string[] =
00676         "n = conn.count( [template_list] )\n"
00677         "Return a count of the tuples in the tuple space. If no template\n"
00678         "list is given, count all the tuples. If there is a template\n"
00679         "list, return only the number of tuples that match at least one\n"
00680         "template.";
00681 
00686 static PyObject *
00687 ctx_count_tuple_space(PyObject * self, PyObject * args)
00688 {
00689         PyObject *pylst = NULL, *pytup;
00690         CtxObject *pyctx;
00691         struct tuple_list *slist, *x;
00692         int i, count, listsize;
00693 
00694         pyctx = (CtxObject *) self;
00695         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|O", &pylst))
00696                 return NULL;
00697         if (pylst != NULL) {
00698                 if (!PyList_Check(pylst)) {
00699                         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00700                                         "argument must be a list");
00701                         return NULL;
00702                 }
00703                 listsize = PyList_Size(pylst);
00704         }
00705         else {
00706                 listsize = 0;
00707         }
00708 
00709 
00710         /* Assemble a list of templates from the arg.
00711          */
00712         slist = NULL;
00713         for (i = 0; i < listsize; i++) {
00714                 pytup = PyList_GetItem(pylst, i);
00715                 if (!PyTuple_Check(pytup)) {
00716                         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
00717                                         "list members must be tuples");
00718                         return NULL;
00719                 }
00720                 x = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple_list));
00721                 if (x == NULL)
00722                         return PyErr_NoMemory();
00723                 x->tup = PyTuple_to_LinuxTuple(pytup, 0);
00724                 x->next = slist;
00725                 slist = x;
00726         }
00727 
00728         x = slist;
00729         while (x != NULL) {
00730                 x = x->next;
00731         }
00732 
00733         /* Do a count request to the server.
00734          */
00735         i = count_tuple_space(slist, &pyctx->ctx, &count);
00736 
00737         while (slist) {
00738                 x = slist;
00739                 slist = slist->next;
00740                 free(x);
00741         }
00742 
00743         if (i != 0)
00744                 return NULL;
00745 
00746         return PyInt_FromLong(count);
00747 }
00748 
00749 static char
00750         ctx_log_doc_string[] =
00751         "Dump a continuous log of tuple space activity to stdout. Call this\n"
00752         "method in a \"while 1:\" loop. Looping in Python rather than C\n"
00753         "means that you can break out of the loop easily with control-C,\n"
00754         "and you can put other code in the loop.";
00755 
00760 static PyObject *
00761 ctx_tuple_server_log(PyObject * self, PyObject * args)
00762 {
00763         CtxObject *pyctx = (CtxObject *) self;
00764         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, ""))
00765                 return NULL;
00766         tuple_server_log(stdout, &pyctx->ctx);
00767         Py_INCREF(Py_None);
00768         return Py_None;
00769 }
00770 
00771 static char
00772         py_random_int_doc_string[] =
00773         "Return a 32-bit random integer, taken from /dev/urandom.";
00774 
00779 static PyObject *
00780 py_random_int(PyObject * self, PyObject * args)
00781 {
00782         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, ""))
00783                 return NULL;
00784         return PyInt_FromLong(random_int());
00785 }

00792 static PyMethodDef linuxtuples_methods[] = {
00793         {"connect", new_ctx, METH_VARARGS, new_ctx_doc_string},
00794         {"random", py_random_int, METH_VARARGS, py_random_int_doc_string},
00795         {NULL, NULL}            /* sentinel */
00796 };

00803 DL_EXPORT(void)
00804 initlinuxtuples()
00805 {
00806         PyObject *m, *d;
00807 
00808         CtxType.ob_type = &PyType_Type;
00809         m = Py_InitModule("linuxtuples", linuxtuples_methods);
00810         d = PyModule_GetDict(m);
00811         PyDict_SetItemString(d, "__doc__",
00812                              PyString_FromString(linuxtuples_doc_string));
00813 }
